newsitem.title: VENEZUELA: Venezuela cement consumption falls 20 pct in Q2.
newsitem.headline: Venezuela cement consumption falls 20 pct in Q2.

text.p: Venezuelan second quarter cement consumption, a leading indicator of economic activity, fell 20 percent to 965,448 tonnes compared to the same period in 1995, Venezuela's cement business chamber (AVPC) said.
"Venezuelan cement consumption between April and July was 965,448 tonnes. Over the same period in the year before, sales reached 1,196,961 tonnes," AVCPC said in a press statement.
Cement sales over the first half of 1996 reached just over two million tonnes, compared to 2,391,739 tonnes in 1995, AVPC added.
Venezuela's recession-gripped non-oil sector is forecast to shrink 3.5 percent over 1996, while the oil sector will grow about 6.2 percent, according to IMF projections.
